content: ode to doris a knitting pattern by kelly brooker ode to doris page 1 ode to doris a tribute to the dainty doris hat pattern this newborncardyshowcases all the things we love about the 1950s femininity practicality and post war newbornbabies this pattern is written for 8ply/dk weight yarn and to fit a newbornbabe 3-4kg 7-9lb in weight with an approximate chest circumference of 37 5cm construction gauge ode to doris has you cast on at the neckline and in stocking stitch work flat utilising raglan increases and forming a 22sts/10cm on 4 0mm needles rounded garter neck line before working the lacework fronts until you reach the required materials chest size from here the arm stitches are put on 2x 12mm buttons to waste yarn or a stitch holder and the body 8ply/dkweight yarn 210-250m/100g finished once the body is completed the sleeve this pattern is suitable for yarn with good stitches are returned to the needles and worked in elasticity and memory a wool or wool blend the round before finishing gathered at the elbow suggested yarn red riding hood yarns belle 434m/200g skills required 0 5 skein knitting small circumferences in the round long tail cast on equipment simple lace 80cm 4 0mm circular needles working top down raglan construction or needle size required to achieve gauge if you are not familiar with these techniques you 6stitch markers may need to
